column4: The system is running in low graphics mode.  I can't ctrl+alt+f1 to get to a command prompt, and can only ssh in.  I can't run Xorg -configure.  What do I do?
I did that and can kill X, but when I run Xorg -configure it errors out about number of detected displays.
this happen cuz u updated the drivers?
think theres a fix i heard about
think u need to install the headers also
actually, sudo apt-get purge nvidia-current, then sudo apt-get install linux-headers-generic, then reboot and install the drivers from the software center
in the future just do a fresh install
I might do a fresh install anyway.  I did all that before coming here :\
if u make like 2 partition, / and /home , fresh install is best
if is on a parition thats not gonna be formatted then is safe
i usually have like 5 paritions, install a distro on each, if one fails i can use another
